SAMI Project

Galkot, Baglung, Nepal

Started: 2076-09-13 BS

Current: 2079-11-11 BS

Work Experience

Detail the work experience, roles, and responsibilities here.

      Facilitation of Workshops: Conducted interactive workshops and training sessions for diverse groups, including youth, women, and small business owners, enhancing their understanding of financial concepts and practices.
      Community Engagement: Collaborated with community leaders and organizations to promote financial literacy initiatives, ensuring participation and buy-in from various stakeholders.
      Resource Creation: Developed educational materials, including guides and toolkits, to support ongoing financial education efforts within the community.
      Monitoring and Evaluation: Assessed the effectiveness of financial literacy programs through surveys and feedback, making necessary adjustments to improve content and delivery.

Projects

Detail the projects worked on, achievements, and contributions here.

    Empowerment Through Education: Empowered over [number] participants with essential financial skills, leading to improved household savings and budgeting practices.
    Sustainable Practices: Encouraged the adoption of sustainable financial practices among local entrepreneurs, helping to increase their business viability and resilience.
    Collaboration with Local Organizations: Partnered with local NGOs and government bodies to expand the reach and impact of financial literacy initiatives, fostering a community-wide approach to economic empowerment.
    Success Stories: Documented and shared success stories of participants who achieved financial independence and improved their livelihoods, serving as motivation for others in the community.
    Capacity Building: Trained local facilitators to continue financial education efforts, ensuring sustainability and ongoing support for community members.
